title: Starting from scratch
subject_group: Climate, Environment, Natural Resources & Disasters/Planting (Plant culture)
Climate, Environment, Natural Resources & Disasters/Landscape gardening
Climate, Environment, Natural Resources & Disasters/Gardens - Design
abstract: A New garden: 1. Planning--2. Tools--3. Soil preparation--4. A new lawn--5. Planting. Renovating a derelict garden: 1. Find out what's there--2.Tidy up the lawn--3.Tidy up the plants--4. Six weeks later--5. The greenhouse--6. The following spring.
description: An instructional video providing informative and simple advice on gardening techniques for the beginner or even the experienced gardener. Presented by Peter Seabrook, a garden specialist who writes and broadcasts both in the UK and the USA, and Anne Swithinbank, a writer and broadcaster for the BBC with regular appearances on Gardeners' World, the video is divided into two programs titled "A New garden" and "Renovating a derelict garden". Each program is dealt with in detailed sections with close-up photography and demonstrations of the techniques used. Also includes a booklet of notes and guidelines.
